description: Dashboard for Spring Boot2 Statistics(by micrometer-prometheus).

panels.description:
Key points about this metric:
1-minute average: This metric specifically measures the load over the past 60 seconds.
Load calculation: The load is calculated as the average number of processes that are either running or waiting for CPU time.
Normalized value: The metric is often normalized to the number of available CPUs. This allows for easier comparison across systems with different hardware configurations.

Interpreting the value:
Value less than 1: The system is underutilized, and there are likely spare CPU resources available.
Value close to 1: The system is moderately loaded, and most CPUs are busy but not overwhelmed.
Value greater than 1: The system is overloaded, and there is a backlog of processes waiting for CPU time.
panels.title: Load Average

panels.description: The percent of time spent on Garbage Collection over all CPUs assigned to the JVM process.

targets.expr: sum(rate(jvm_gc_pause_seconds_sum{application="$application", instance="$instance"}[1m])) by (application, instance) / on(application, instance) system_cpu_count

panels.title: GC Pressure

title: Spring Boot Monitoring
